snippet: Shawn Mitchell, the San Diego Chargers’ chaplain, said on Thursday that Junior Seau’s family would allow his brain to be examined by researchers who study head trauma.
abstract: Family of the late NFL linebacker Junior Seau, who died of a self-inflicted gunshot wound to the chest, will allow his brain to be examined by researchers who study head trauma. (M)
lead_paragraph: The family of the former N.F.L. linebacker Junior Seau will allow his brain to be examined by researchers who study head trauma, according to a chaplain for the San Diego Chargers. Seau, 43, was found dead in his Oceanside, Calif., home Wednesday morning of a self-inflicted gunshot wound to the chest. He did not leave a note.

headline.main: Family of Seau Decides To Give Brain for Study
